title: Welcome to Planet Honors
description: (3 crs.) Examine local manifestations of complex global issues on the URI campus and in surrounding environments and communities. Utilize interdisciplinary approaches, design thinking tools, and principles of effective communication to develop competencies in creative problem solving and civic engagement. (Lec. 3) (B2) (C1) Pre: Honors eligible

title: Honors Seminar in Natural Sciences
description: (3-4 crs.) Exploration of themes and topics in the natural sciences. Topics include: Life in the Universe; Biological Consequences of Global Change; Biology for the Citizen; the Physics of Sports; Oceans, Atmospheres, and Global Change. (Seminar)  Must have 3.40 overall GPA.

title: Honors in Social Sciences and Civic Knowledge
description: (3-4 crs.) Honors Seminar in Social Sciences and Civic Knowledge. Topics include : Loss in the Lives of Children and Adolescents. (Seminar) Pre: Must have a 3.4 overall GPA. (A2) (C1)

title: Honors in Soc & Behav Sci and Diversity & Incl.
description: (3-4 crs.) Honors Seminar in Social & Behavioral Science and Diversity & Inclusion. (Seminar) Pre: Must have a 3.4 overall GPA. (A2) (C3)

title: Honors in STEM and Communicate Effectively
description: (3 crs.) Exploration of themes and topics in the field of Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) and Communicating Effectively. (Lec. 3) Pre: 3.40 overall GPA or better.  (A1) (B2) (GC)

title: Honors in STEM and Global Responsibilities
description: (3 crs.) Exploration of themes and topics in the Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics and Global Responsibilities. (Seminar) Pre: 3.40 overall or better GPA.  (A1) (C2)

title: Honors in Writing and Information Literacy
description: (3-4 crs.) Exploration of the elements of writing and developing information literacy. Topics include: Building Bridges: Writing about Common Reading; Writing and Empathy; Writing to Understand: Ethnographic Explorations. (Seminar) Pre: must have 3.40 overall GPA. (B1) (B4)

title: Honors in Humanities and Writing
description: (3 crs.) Exploration of themes, topics, and techniques in literature, humanities and writing. (Seminar) Pre: 3.40 overall or better GPA.  (A3) (B1)

title: Honors in Diversity & Inclusion and Information Literacy
description: (3 crs.) Exploration of themes and topics in Diversity & Inclusion and Information Literacy. (Seminar) Pre: 3.40 overall GPA. (C3) (B4) (GC)

title: Honors Colloquium in Humanities and Diversity and Inclusion
description: (3-4 crs.) HPR Honors Colloquium may be repeated for a maximum of 8 credits. Topics include:  Religion in America. (Lec. 3, Rec. 1) Pre: GPA of 3.4 or above and one completed honors course, or permission of the director of the honors program. (A3) (C3) (GC)

title: Honors Colloquium in Soc. Science and Civic Knowledge
description: (3-4 crs.) HPR Honors Colloquia may be repeated for a maximum of 6-8 credits. Topics include: Trekonomics: Life and Economics in a Post-Scarcity World. (Lec. 3 or Lec. 3, Rec. 1) Pre: GPA of 3.4 or above and one completed honors course, or permission of the director of the honors program. (A2) (C1) (GC)

title: Honors Colloquium in Diversity and Social & Behavioral Sciences
description: (3-4 crs.) HPR Honors Colloquia may be repeated for a maximum of 8 credits. (Lec. 3, Rec. 1)  Pre: GPA of 3.4 or above and one completed honors course, or permission of the director of the honors program. (C3) (A2) (GC)

title: Honors Colloquium in STEM
description: (3-4 crs.) May be repeated for a maximum of 8 credits. (Lec. 2-3, Rec. 1-2) Pre: GPA of 3.40 or better and one completed Honors course or permission of the director of the Honors Program. (A1) (GC)

title: Honors Colloquium in STEM and Information Literacy
description: (3-4 crs.) May be repeated for a maximum of 8 credits. (Lec. 2-3, Rec. 1-2) Pre: GPA of 3.40 or better and one completed Honors course, or permission of the director of the Honors Program. (A1) (B4)

title: Honors Tutorial Topic: Administrative Internship
description: (1-4 crs.) Experiential course that provides an opportunity for students to learn and practice administrative decision-making and to develop research skills in an administrative setting. Placements include Brown Medical School, the Institute for International Sport, RI Planned Parenthood, and the URI Honors program. (Practicum) Pre: GPA of 3.50 or better and permission of the Director of the Honors Program.

title: Honors Tutorial Topic: Administrative Internship
description: (1-4 crs.) A continuation of HPR 301.  (Practicum) Pre: GPA of 3.50 or better and permission of the Director of the Honors Program.

title: Honors Seminar in Diversity & Inclusion and Humanities
description: (3-4 crs.) Honors Seminar in the exploration of themes and topics in Diversity & Inclusion and Humanities. (Seminar) Pre: 3.40 GPA or better or permission of the director of the honors program. (C3) (A3)

title: Honors Seminar in Arts & Design and Writing
description: (3-4 crs.) Honors seminar in arts and design and writing. (Seminar) Pre: 3.40 GPA or better or permission of the director of the Honors Program. (A4) (B1)

title: Honors Seminar in Communicate Effectively and Integrate & Apply
description: (3 crs.) Honors Seminar exploring themes and topics in the fields of Communicating Effectively and Integrate and Application. (Lec. 3) Pre: 3.40 or better overall GPA. (B2) (D1) (GC)

title: Honors Seminar in Humanities and Writing
description: (3-4 crs.) Honors Seminar in Humanities and Writing. (Seminar) Pre: 3.4 overall GPA. (A3) (B1)

title: Honors Seminar in Comm Effect. and Info Lit
description: (3-4 crs.) Exploration of themes and topics contributing to development of competencies in Information Literacy and Communicate Effectively. (Lec. 3-4) Pre: Overall 3.4 gpa or higher. (B2) (B4)

title: Honors Seminar in Global Responsibility and Social Sciences
description: (3-4 crs.) This course engages undergraduate Honors' students in the core aspects of global responsibility and social science. (Lec. 3-4) Pre: Overall GPA 3.40 or better. (A2) (C2)

title: Honors Seminar in Comm Effectively & Civic Knowledge & Responsibilities
description: (3-4 crs.) Exploration of themes and topics contributing to development of competencies in Communicate Effectively and Civic Knowledge and Responsibility. (Lec. 3-4) (B2) (C1)

title: Honors Seminar in Civic Engagement & Soc. and Beh. Science
description: (3 crs.) Engages undergraduate honorï¿½s students in the core aspects of citizen science with a focus on self-experimentation in social, behavioral, health and medical realms.  The course involves engaging with citizen science networks, self-and group change in networked contexts, and associated computing, research methods and interpretive skills. (Lec., Rec., Seminar) Pre: 3.40 over GPA or better.  (C1) (A2)

title: Honors Directed Study
description: (1-4 crs.) (Independent Study) Pre: 3.40 GPA or better or permission of the director of the honors program.

title: Honors Project
description: (3 crs.) (Independent Study) Pre: permission of the director of the Honors Program, and overall GPA of 3.40 or better. (D1)

title: Honors Project
description: (3 crs.) (Independent Study) Pre: permission of the director of the Honors Program, and overall GPA of 3.40 or better.

title: Honors Seminar
description: (3 crs.) Topics include: 'Controversies in Environmental Science;' and 'Film and Video Practicum.' (Seminar) Pre: overall GPA 3.40 or better.

title: Honors Seminar
description: (3-4 crs.) (Seminar) Pre: overall GPA 3.40 or better.
